info.title: Infectious Disease API
info.description: An infectious disease is a clinically evident human disease resulting from the presence of pathogenic microbial agents, like pathogenic viruses, pathogenic bacteria, fungi, protozoa, multicellular parasites, and prions. To be considered an infectious disease, such pathogens are known to be able to cause this disease.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Keyword search for item

parameters.name: additionaltype
parameters.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the \'typeof\' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

parameters.name: alternatename
parameters.description: An alias for the item.

parameters.name: associatedanatomy
parameters.description: The anatomy of the underlying organ system or structures associated with this entity.

parameters.name: cause
parameters.description: An underlying cause. More specifically, one of the causative agent(s) that are most directly responsible for the pathophysiologic process that eventually results in the occurrence.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: A medical code for the entity, taken from a controlled vocabulary or ontology such as ICD-9, DiseasesDB, MeSH, SNOMED-CT, RxNorm, etc.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A short description of the item.

parameters.name: differentialdiagnosis
parameters.description: One of a set of differential diagnoses for the condition. Specifically, a closely-related or competing diagnosis typically considered later in the cognitive process whereby this medical condition is distinguished from others most likely responsible for a similar collection of signs and symptoms to reach the most parsimonious diagnosis or diagnoses in a patient.

parameters.name: epidemiology
parameters.description: The characteristics of associated patients, such as age, gender, race etc.

parameters.name: expectedprognosis
parameters.description: The likely outcome in either the short term or long term of the medical condition.

parameters.name: guideline
parameters.description: A medical guideline related to this entity.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

parameters.name: infectiousagent
parameters.description: The actual infectious agent, such as a specific bacterium.

parameters.name: infectiousagentclass
parameters.description: The class of infectious agent (bacteria, prion, etc.) that causes the disease.

parameters.name: mainentityofpage
parameters.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described.            See background notes for details.       Inverse property: mainEntity.

parameters.name: medicinesystem
parameters.description: The system of medicine that includes this MedicalEntity, for example \'evidence-based\', \'homeopathic\', \'chiropractic\', etc.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the item.

parameters.name: naturalprogression
parameters.description: The expected progression of the condition if it is not treated and allowed to progress naturally.

parameters.name: pathophysiology
parameters.description: Changes in the normal mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions that are associated with this activity or condition.

parameters.name: possiblecomplication
parameters.description: A possible unexpected and unfavorable evolution of a medical condition. Complications may include worsening of the signs or symptoms of the disease, extension of the condition to other organ systems, etc.

parameters.name: possibletreatment
parameters.description: A possible treatment to address this condition, sign or symptom.

parameters.name: potentialaction
parameters.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an \'object\' role.

parameters.name: primaryprevention
parameters.description: A preventative therapy used to prevent an initial occurrence of the medical condition, such as vaccination.

parameters.name: recognizingauthority
parameters.description: If applicable, the organization that officially recognizes this entity as part of its endorsed system of medicine.

parameters.name: relevantspecialty
parameters.description: If applicable, a medical specialty in which this entity is relevant.

parameters.name: riskfactor
parameters.description: A modifiable or non-modifiable factor that increases the risk of a patient contracting this condition, e.g. age,  coexisting condition.

parameters.name: sameas
parameters.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item\'s identity. E.g. the URL of the item\'s Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

parameters.name: secondaryprevention
parameters.description: A preventative therapy used to prevent reoccurrence of the medical condition after an initial episode of the condition.

parameters.name: signorsymptom
parameters.description: A sign or symptom of this condition. Signs are objective or physically observable manifestations of the medical condition while symptoms are the subjective experience of the medical condition.

parameters.name: stage
parameters.description: The stage of the condition, if applicable.

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: A medical study or trial related to this entity.

parameters.name: subtype
parameters.description: A more specific type of the condition, where applicable, for example \'Type 1 Diabetes\', \'Type 2 Diabetes\', or \'Gestational Diabetes\' for Diabetes.

parameters.name: transmissionmethod
parameters.description: How the disease spreads, either as a route or vector, for example \'direct contact\', \'Aedes aegypti\', etc.

parameters.name: typicaltest
parameters.description: A medical test typically performed given this condition.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the item.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id for item

parameters.name: id
